2. Honoraria for outside speakers. Probably one or two outstanding
people could be brought In to strengthen the program* If no funds are
so employed we must rely upon nhome-grown” speakers*
3* Banquet the final night* (Prices range from $2*75 to $4*75*)
Another source of financing is a registration fee* Region I, at its
recent meeting, charged an $8 fee* This brought them in about $1|.00
which added to the Headquarter contribution gave them a budget of about
$800 and covered speakers1 fees and a cocktail party* The Continuing
Education Service of Michigan State charges a $2*00 fee per conferee
anyway and we might add on to this so as to derive a few dollars from
each registrant*

The above budgets make no contribution toward defying expenses of
conferees. However, Region IIIfers came to Purdue without any assurance
of expense contributions and I think they111 come to East Lansing on
their own, too.
Program:
I* Region Network Possibilities
a* Report of Engineering Committee
b* Report of Program Committee
II* The NAEB and Its Services
III* Plans for the Detroit Convention
a* Report of Convention Committee
And those are the only items I have to offer at th^jmoment. I enclose
the agenda of our last Region III Meeting for reference and suggestions.
Can I have some fast reactions to this memo and any idea you have on
a program, participants, etc. Speed is the thing* Just scrible on
the back of these pages if it will accelerate the communication
process.
